data.text: How in the world can such a conceptually simple and ancient app lack so many basic features? Can't add custom colors. Can't set it so back doesn't accidentally close a sheet. Images aren't cached. Rearranging sheet order is ridiculously slow. Can't access justify or borders unless in landscape mode. References to cells in other sheets must be done manually. Worst part is that on android, this app is still vastly superior to the web app on both chrome and Firefox based browsers.
data.replyText: Hello there, thanks for sharing your valuable feedback. We'll pass this along to our team. Appreciate it!

data.text: It blows my mind that such a rich company can't provide an app with basic functions. First off, this app crashes and or gets held up when entering data. I'll often need to reenter data updates. The undo feature apparently can undo its self enough to close the app. Upon reopening all data entry is lost. I'm running the pixel 7 with high speed internet and great cellular signal. I'm sure the developer will have some excuse. Years of using this app and its never improved. Google need to listen
data.replyText: Hi there. We suggest you clear apps cache on your device: Settings - Apps - Sheets - Storage & cache - Clear cache. Also, make sure you have a good network connectivity. Try signing out & signing back in and see if all the documents have synced. If that doesn't fix the issue you can ask our experts on the Help forum: goo.gle/3o58rPT. Thanks.

data.text: Well, it was working well for what I needed it for until it started NOT opening the files and popping up saying it couldn't open the files with this version of the app, but when I click update app it brings me to the app store but there is no update option, only open or uninstall . And according to about this app, there hasn't been an update since June 8, 2021.
data.replyText: Hi Cheyenne. We recommend you check if there are any network connectivity issues or check this article to troubleshoot: https://goo.gle/3ONnjLM. You can also try clearing apps cache on your device: Settings - Apps - Sheets - Storage & cache - Clear cache. Thank you.

data.text: would be great if it didn't randomly set my shared documents **that I myself created** to view only, thus preventing me from making any further edits. would also be great if i could fix this from mobile, as i have no pc, and it says it can only be changed with pc. furthermore, i find that strange, since the only person i have shared one particular document with also has no pc. so overnight it mysteriously randomly set itself to view only. thanks google. (sarcasm.) it does this with docs too.

I am constantly having issues where Google Sheets goes into view only mode. It'll only happen on certain spreadsheets. I can edit them on desktop so it seems to be an issue with the app. Needing to make edits quickly on mobile and not being able to is extremely frustrating. I have Google One and I'm thinking of switching to a different suite of services altogether because it's really unacceptable now unreliable it is.

I love this app and use it constantly. It would get five stars, except for one thing. You cannot create named ranges, which I would use constantly, if I could. I've tried emailing about it, and get a message saying that the address is no longer being monitored. I'm honestly annoyed. This is the best spreadsheet app I know, but the exclusion of this already-existing feature is seriously hampering my workflow. So I'm making some noise here with the hopes of catching someone's attention.
data.replyText: Hi Trevor. You may post the query in Docs community and get help from our experts: https://goo.gle/3o58rPT. Thank you.

data.text: This app can be extremely hard to work with. Features improving but still have a long way to go, especially with text format and charts. Text color formatting in dark mode is extremely difficult and unpredictable. Lately, the app repeatedly freezes when I open it. I checked for an update in "manage apps and device", amd no update was listed. Yet, when I came to the app page, it shows an option to update. Perhaps that is a bug in Play Store, but maybe someone on Sheets should look at this also?

Since new update, the first time trying to copy a row crashed the app. Immediately following that crash, it now crashes every time I try to reopen that or ANY spreadsheet as soon as I touch any cell. Cleared cache of Sheets, Drive, Gboard (the cache inside the app options itself and the apps' caches in Android). No change. Rendered completely unusable.
data.replyText: Hi there. You may post the query in Docs community and get help from our experts: https://goo.gle/3o58rPT. Thank you.

data.text: PLEASE fix filtering on mobile devices!! It would be so freaking fantastic if I could just my stupid slicer OR filter on my phone/on-the-go...but I can't..."only available on desktop"...and it looks like this has been a problem for a while now with many reporting the same issues...PLEASE FIX!! Would absolutely use this daily!
data.replyText: Hello Tyler, thanks for sharing your valuable feedback. We'll pass this along to our team. Appreciate it!

data.text: Use it for counting inventory at work. Bought a Galaxy tab a and it constantly crashes, freezes, lags and just doesn't update. It is kept up-to-date with proper updating of the software and has great signal. App works great on anyother device but this one. Please fix it so it's with in the compatable device list. Not this "this app may not be optimized for you device" bc that's very very frustrating.

It gets the job done. But it sure is a pain and lacks features I have come to view as basic. For example, formula references are difficult to update. It is easier to just manually type the references. Another example, there is no ability to refresh formulas. Instead the sheet updates on a schedule or based on changes to the sheet. Its okay and its free but it is not great and leaves a lot to be desired.

Pretty good for on the go editing. Feedback: I strongly object to the removal of the "select range" option. When working on a smartphone screen, this is absolutely essential. Without it, I have to keep scrolling over and over, often picking up or losing unintended cells in my selection. Please, please restore the "Select Range" function. I also need to be able to open or import .csv files. It's very inconvenient to use a different app for this alone.

I recently kicked out WPS because every update deleted more and more features. I replaced it with Google Docs and Google Sheets. I would give a higher rating, but at present I'm still trying Google Sheets on to see what it's capabilities are. So far I'm quite pleased except in one thing: when I modify a sheet, it saves entirely new as opposed to saving as modified. This is a waste of memory space and a constant source of aggravation; searching thru many copies to locate the most recent mod.

The android/chromebook app is missing the PC menu. Without this menu nearly ALL options are difficult to find, and some are outright impossible! For example, there is no way to set a custom date format (I prefer mm/dd/yy for all dates, and leading zeros are an absolute requirement!). Support is impossible to access, and the Help is less than useful.

Decent spreadsheet with some powerful functionality (see the QUERY function!) The user interface could use a lot of improvement; some configuration settings are in the sidebar, some are in a pop-up menu and other are found in the upper-right menu. It makes it annoying to try to find an option. Also, Android implementations can't add or edit named ranges. Why?!

Since tge update, this app no longer works for android, constantly says can't refresh and displays no information. It says the are bug fixes when in fact there is a new major bug. This app has been rendered useless. If you want to use this app with Android, you'll have to uninstall and then re-install the app with every use. Update: Major bug fixed. App is running smoothly again so far. When this app works, it is so useful. I use this app on a daily basis to get work done.

Bug-ridden. I love the Google software. For the most part, its seemless simplicity is an ingenious unique selling proposition. Google sheets for mobile, however, has an Achilles heel. When editing a textbox, if the user scrolls down, you lose all text. There is no way to retrieve it again. After having this happen to a paragraph I was trying to write for the seventh time, I gave up. Fix this and the review will be changed.

It has its challenges compared to the original options on a desktop, laptop or chromebook. But on the fly it is super helpful. I am a teacher and travel between classrooms and I am a coach. It is great in situations where i need to edit something between classes. I use it all the time at swim meets when updating records on the fly. But as I said before I have struggled with some features, but it works fine to make quick changes and updates.

Google Sheets is a pretty nice app, it's convinient to be able to view and edit docs on the go, and collaborate with others. The issue is it's implementation on Android. it has awful keyboard support, using a physical keyboard requires a keypress to begin typing, before you can add any data, so you'll find yourself frequently missing letters. additionally, the colors don't align with the desktop version, changing based on your device, and making some sheets unreadable. I really wish it worked.

Look, I get that a mobile app's gonna have less usability compared to the desktop version, but there's two things that really bug me. On desktop, there's this neat trick where you'd use Alt+Enter to create a line break in a cell. On mobile however, the only way you're gonna do that is through copypasting, and even then, only in a very specific way. The app also only lets you select SOME of a sheet's custom colors, so you gotta copypaste cells that contain the color you're looking for.

Mostly great. However, I'm extremely frustrated by the issue where my sheets will render as view only at least once a day, sometimes more. I have to uninstall and reinstall the updates every time to be able to edit my sheets again. I can't access my sheets without having the buggy update installed, either. This has been going on for a long time.

If Google Sheets was not free, it would deserve four stars; but being as feature-rich as it is, AND it's free? It's pretty amazing. It's remarkably similar to Excel, which is great. It's compatible with Excel, which is also great. It automatically saves, which is more great. And it's free. It's simple to use, and has a professional look and feel to it. And the integration with other Google Apps and Extensions is very cool. Only real complaint: Chart options really suck on the mobile app.

It's ok... Gotta be honest though. The inability to zoom in and out on my spread sheets makes using the app cumbersome. I will be switching to just using the Web Browser version where I have no issues with this. Adding this "feature" would greatly improve my experience with it. Not sure why it's not in here as that hasnt been a missing "feature" of spread sheet programs since the 90's haha.

I have had a great run with this app during the last three years of needing it for work. I rated lower because data on my screen has been blurring anytime I scroll the screen down or up. It clears up at some point but happens again when I need to scroll again. It impairs my vision and distracts me from work tasks. Please fix this issue. :-)

Almost unusable. I need to dig into my phone's settings and delete the app data frequently. The ONLY thing I use this for is tracking my workout at the gym, and it can't even manage light use of a basic spreadsheet without getting forced into "view only mode" and requiring a reset. It can even happen in the middle of using it. The fact this is still happening in 2023 is frankly astounding. This is on a phone that just released this year. I'm going to try Excel instead, Google clearly won't fix.

In the last month or so it's begun getting out of sync. And, most crucially, that results in lost or corrupted data. I open a sheet in the app and edits I've made in Chrome don't show up. When I make updates in the app and I open it in Chrome, the earlier edits I made in Chrome are gone, or mixed up with the app edits. This is a critical problem that needs to be fixed.

Does the most basic things taken from Excel 1999. However, thing like deleting rows/columns it not supported. So, be careful adding these. There is no functionality for manipulating cells beyond text, color and fill. You might be able to find the font screen, but good luck. Weirdest thing is that it will resize your work radomly. Like if a screenhot is taken of your work and you have it constructed so that all fit in the screen, it could change in an hour or week. Had to switch to another app.

No longer opens any Excel files from my phone's internal storage. I just get the message "Can't open this document. Google Sheets was unable to open your spreadsheet." This is a very recent issue and I can find no workaround for it. Was any functionality remove in recent updates? Update 8/10/2022 ... Most recent update seems to have corrected the issue. No problem opening locally stored docs.

Quite good, but with a fatal flaw. When I select a cell, then scroll down and hold to open the copy, paste, autofill menu, data from the selected cells is moved down, requiring an undo. I'm shocked by how well it works otherwise and that it's a project that has been declared worthy of development, but this bug makes it unusable for sheets with more than a few rows.

Love it!!!! Saves as it goes (wish you would make it auto save upon no activity or closing only though because can be difficult to undo several actions. the undo button allows you to choose down to a certain event but will clear everything up to it also. Has nearly every feature minus a few paste special calculation commands but there other ways to accomplish what I'm trying to do so no problem. love that it syncs across the devices! keep up the great work Google!! and thanks for making it FREE!

App makes it easy to access & edit your sheets online or even offline from your Android or tablet. One gripe I do have about it is there's no sort function on the app, this still has to be done from a PC. The other thing is Google Docs/Sheets only allows for exportation to ???x files (a later version of DOC & XLS files), not the older formats, so I can't export to my PC because I use an older version of Microsoft Office...

Works well overall. Impressed at how well they've translated spreadsheets to the mobile experience. Wish it wouldn't constantly change the order of the options in the context menus. There's also something wrong with how it chooses the numeric vs. alphabetic keyboards for each cell, but I can't quite put my finger on what it is.

App opens documents successfully and then opens a model dialog box saying that document can't be opened and that I either need to close the document or update. This is obviously a tactic to get people to update and has little to do with the program actually being able to read the sheet. It was particularly frustrating today because I needed to fix an extremely time sensitive problem and I couldn't refer to our notes due to this behavior. I ended up converting the file and downloading it.

Very useful app. However there is a bug that continues to happen where it will switch me, the only authorized user of the sheet, to a view only setting where I don't have any ability to change any of my sheets. I found a work around that I can do by clearing the data and cache, and since these are on the cloud I don't lose anything and am again able to use the application normally. If you fix this bug permanently I will change review to 5 stars as I actually love the functionality of this app.

Doesn't upload changes anymore. I use this to keep exercises logs. I open pre-made Excel sheets from within the Drive app and edit them as I work out. When I check my computer later, I see the file hasn't been updated. When I open Sheets, it says "Incomplete upload" for the file in question, with the option to manually upload the changes. Today I didn't even get that, and ended up losing a whole week of logs. My workflow is now broken because of how unreliable this software is.

Less than useless. No dragging to complete equations, you have to hold, copy, hold, paste on each cell, though you can select multiple cells, which makes it easier. Furthermore, after doing that multiple times, I tried to get a sum going and my keyboard only showed but Era and there was no option to type letters at all. So I would've had to do c1+c2+c3+c4.... etc. This app is awful. I can't find any info about it online as to how to work it properly, so I can only assume there is no way to do so

Where do I even begin. This app had zero functionality of Google Sheets. All it can do is give you the ability to view things that you did on your computer on your phone. Attempting to do anything independent of your phone will result in a headache, shortly followed by your phone hitting the wall in a fit of rage. This app was inadequate in all regards. It was so bad that I then went and downloaded Excel hoping it would be better. It was better. -1/10 can not recommend.

With this app, there is no excuse to not keep track of your spending. Enter your balance plus or minus income or expenditures in one column, and put the date and description in the other column. Drag and highlight the two rows to get the sum or difference to know what your true money balance is. No more guesswork, surprise overdrawals, etc. If my numbers are different than what's on my bank app, I know exactly what is still pending and what checks haven't been acknowledged by the system yet. This is a quick yet efficient way to track your spending, and you can set it up so that it flows with your life. It's so easy that I'm now in the habit of logging an expenditure and photographing my receipt before I leave the store parking lot because it only takes a few seconds. Use your smartphone to actually do something smart for once, and keep your finances in check with the completely free Google Sheets app.

Considering Chromebook sales and usage spiked during the pandemic, what with distance learning and work-from-home, a reasonable person would expect Google would have made their spreadsheet app at least stable. I'm sure someone reasonable MUST work in the Sheets department, but one would never guess from the app. It opens a file, I try to go to the cell I was working on, it promptly crashes and must be reopened. How is a body supposed to get any work done in these conditions?!

Pissing in the wind.... I make the same edits multiple times. Once? Maybe since there's duplicated information I haven't worked on this section. Twice? Nope. Especially when I obsessively save everything. Using it on the phone is difficult to navigate and easy to mess up. Also why is there not a "search" function? Or way to apply a rule to cells that contain certain data-without having to search and edit every one of thousands of cells individually? Hopefully other apps will work with excel

Great little (limited) app 4 your phone. Kinda like a little notepad for numbers. Build simple daily use stuff, have to experience what it can do and then figure out what u can do/use it 4 - not the other way around. The templates (for me) were badly done and very rigid. but, they kinda show what can be done with it. NEEDS documentation and the help function sucks....Did/Can I say that!🤣

Its okay enough, but it is missing some functionality that would make editing my spreadsheets alot easier and cleaner. One such as Text Clipping, Formatting cells for just Text or Integers, etc. I have things that would overlap into other cells, if I choose wrap, its makes the cell expand to unreadble proportions. THe option for Text CLippign exists on the desktop, but not on Mobile/Tablet. Not holding my breath though that things of osuch will ever be implemented.

It used to be great. Suddenly it tries to sync all my files offline even though I have that feature turned off. It does not stop, it just continues trying, the notification in my drop down menu stays there with the bar constantly going until I restart my phone to make it go away. FIX IT GOOGLE, THIS IS UNACCEPTABLE BECAUSE IT AFFECTS BATTERY LIFE!

I'm trying to use my tablet for work and there are many times where sheets won't load documents, or it takes many times of opening them for it to push the data to the document. The clipboard bugs out; if I copy something from another app to paste in this app, it just won't. I can paste the same thing from and to many other apps and then when I attempt in sheets it only spits out the last thing that I had copied from sheets. Also, still can't do linebreaks in a cell which is very frustrating.

Extremely easy and not annoying to edit spreadsheets. Much much easier and more likeable than Microsoft's Excel, which takes too long to load even when accessing already-open app through the overview. Google sheets loads quickly, even for documents containing a lot of data, and is immediately able to be edited upon switching back to all from another app, home screen, or overview. Pleased with the app, as it takes to less space than other spreadsheet apps.

Switched over because Quick-onset started crashing on Excel documents it had been working fine with for two years, and at the worst possible time. Though sheets does render things slightly different than I expected on my phone, everything comes up perfectly in Excel on my computer, meaning I can travel everywhere with the current data on Drive and update on the fly without having to rework formatting.

What a pain to use!!! A spreadsheet should be simple to make entries. Not Sheets. Its not just that it doesn't respond, pop up keyboards block the view with no way to remove them. Cells can usually be selected, but entries are not always accepted. Picture yourself trying to enter data real time and real time has passed you by while your fiddling wirh Google Sheets. You can write data in a notebook and transfer it to Sheets when you have time...

You cannot search the entire workbook, only 1 page. You cannot add page name, number, etc, to print options. You cannot view file history... All i wanted to do was share rail yard inventory with the crew using a link they access whenever they need the info, while also having access to revision history to track down any mistakes, and print it out. You can't from mobile.. Microsoft excel can though.. Unfortunately, excel isnt an option when they try to open an excel file, it doesn't associate

There are currently memory leak issues. While inputting long strings into the formula, eventually the keyboard holds data then randomly spits out said data, slows down to a crawl, and the cursor alignment becomes inconsistent. This does not only stay in the app, but persists afterwards, with the only solution being to restart the phone. I didn't expect a memory leak on a google app of all things. I'll keep a 1 star review until this massive bug is fixed.

I love the new dark mode, but please give us the option to prevent spreadsheets from going into dark mode as well. I know that I can just switch back, but I don't want to do that every time. I want to set the original colors of my sheets as default, possibly on a per-sheet basis if possible. I have a few sheets where I picked colors for thematic relevance to the content of the cell, not just differentiating stuff.

this a great tool to use when data collection or processing is needed, especially when formulas are treasured to do math. it's similar to Excel, but not too intuitive for familiar Excel users. Whatever menus are common to Excel are not all easily found, at least not yet. it's great that it it's in the Google set so it's accessible from phone or other computing devices. i will continue to use it and learn.

Unable to edit several cells. When I select the cells, I get a pop-up box message saying: This cell's contents violate its validation rule. When I try to edit the cell, it gives me this error message: Loading data validation options. Please try again. The app has become unusable. When I try to view the file with Microsoft Excel, the data is corrupted, but no error messages.

The UI is clean & logical. Operation of Sheets when opening documents is quick. Unfortunately, Sheets is ineffective for viewing documents larger than 680 MB. The first time I attempted to open a large document, Sheets gave an Unable To Open This File error. On the second attempt to open the same file, Sheets smoothly opened the document but left large swaths of blank, open areas in place of text. The third time, Sheets errored: File Too Large. I uninstalled Sheets. I expected more, Google.

I have had no problems until the latest update. Ever since then I keep getting an error (Cannot open file, please check internet connection) when I try to open one specific file. The file opens fine on my browser, but on the app it refuses to open. Out of the ones I've tested it's the only one with an xlsx extension - not sure if that's related. Please fix! Thanks.

Doesn't work well on older OS (4.2). Office file type .CSV will work ok, but trying to save as a Google docs file, it says it can't even open it unless i update to latest version. I get to play store...& I'm using the latest version available (on this device, at least). So, i can use the competition's file type & view the file, but but not Google's.

As stated by others, losing data. For some odd reason when I email the document to my accounting they get all different info than I'm seeing. And no matter which way I try to fix it all the data I'm lookingnat is not the same data that gets received on the other end. I've had to save it as a pdf in Google drive and forward it that way. It's become very aggrivating

I have always loved this app, it is very useful, but since yesterday it has been crashing every time that I try to edit any document in my account. I tap on a cell in any sheet and get the "Sorry!" message. I have tried updating, uninstalling and reinstalling, restarting my device, and clearing the app cache. Can anyone tell me what I can do to reverse this?

Unlike the mobile app version of Google Docs, I find the mobile version of Google Sheets annoying to scroll through just to get where I want to edit something (if it would let me without messing something up), and the last time I used it there weren't many options available for customization or making things easier. Unless you feel like you really need it for whatever reason, I advise sticking with the browser version.

I use this app for everything I can, because it is so much fun to use. Organizing data is easy with powerful features like: dragging rows and columns; cell auto-fill (up, down, left, right); special pasting options; excellent formula help; conditional formatting using built in options or custom formulas; and date entry via calendar (using data validation). Finally, the Query command is an extremely powerful way to arranging data.

Sometimes it just doesn't even work. When opening another person's sheet, it will sometimes glitch and not show full cells. Other times it won't let you scroll all the way to the right so you're stuck only reading part of the sheet. Desktop version is much better and smoother, only use this app if you absolutely have no other choices.

Basic functions are not (easily) available. Not sure if I am just completely overlooking it but I cannot find the number formatting option anywhere. I have looked it up on google and the location google says it is, I have checked, and it is not there. Also, you cannot easily switch between tabs, you have to check the blue check at the top before switching between tabs in one sheet. Another issue is that I cannot open the same sheet in two separate windows. Please advise!

Keeps switching to View only even though I'm the owner and editor! It does this on Android. On my desktop there's a different issue. When I try to open Sheets it asks me download a browser. There's a list to choose from. I download one and get the same issue when I try to log in. I have tried downloading several different ones but nothing works. I didn't use to have this problem.

Not as easy or maneuverable as Excel: limited features (no bold or italics) and fonts; must tap the check mark in upper left corner after each move done (enter a text color, type text in a cell, cut, paste, copy, etc.); can't delete columns and rows; can't remove alternate row color fills once you've done sheet w/o undoing lots of input. Handy for simple mobile use.

Obviously it's not going to be as smooth as using a mouse but this is ridiculous. I have tiny hands that have barely changed since kindergarten, yet I can't copy and paste a data row to save my life with this thing. Once I finally get the cells selected and long press for options It either moves the selected cells to the right, or copies and paste them where I want but then repeats the cells indefinitely. Was hoping the latest update would fix it but no. I'm just done with this app. 😮‍💨

Sheets is good, I've been using it for twenty years on the web and this app version for the last couple years. it's still not as good as excel and there has been times when Google has locked me out of my own files thinking that I was somehow violating their silly terms when in fact, I wasn't but it took them weeks to resolve the issue nonetheless and of course no apology or anything just quietly restored my access! What a bunch of BS and it was always for the most important files!

Love the app, but I need to be able to add background images like I would in excel. Fix this in an update, and my rating will go to a 5. Update: Still have this issue, and numerous others with things that work in excel but not here, but it's unfair to keep it at a one because I do get a lot of use out of it, and it still makes the most sense for me with its compatability with other Google products.

Great App, have used it for a long time and have always thought it was useful and easy to use. However, recently I have been having an issue that sheets I own are coming up as "view only". Which makes no sense as I created and own it. This comes and goes, so I have no idea why it happens. Rating would be higher without this exceedingly annoying bug.

View only It started out Great! My daughter and I wanted to have a spreadsheet of our exercises to motivate each other since we live 3 hours away from each other. Now neither one of us can access it because it keeps saying VIEW ONLY!! I would recommend looking for another app. If you Google this error (Google Sheets view only) like I did you would see they have been having trouble with it for years on Android but haven't fixed the problem. SO DISAPPOINTING..I Have 5 spreadsheet I can't access

This app helps my husband and I stay on the same page as far as our monthly bills go like what date we need to make payments on each bill and the cost for that specific bill. We can both edit sheets at the same time even though we aren't together. We can also see what the other is editing or changing in real time. I love this app and how it keeps us organized!

I don't use this, but can't delete it. while I've never even opened it, I get repeated notices that it has crashed. so it's plainly hogging my resources in the background. And, like many apps, in the play store, it's not optimised for tablets. Yet another fine product that Google INSIST'S I need, and DO NOT want. I only gave it 1 star, the lowest, but when I posted my review, it had mysteriously changed to a 3 so edited my review. Real nice Google. Update HEY Google, still crashes, no uninstall

Sheets is my number one used program on desktop. I love it for building weird calculators and simulating all sorts of theoretical real world scenarios. But the mobile version lacks a couple critical tools that make it impossible to use for building utopian datasets. No find/replace available across functions. And no fine tuning of charts. Both of these are available in the desktop version just not the mobile version which is unfortunate.

Works well for the most part. Biggest gripe I have is that I can't apply an existing filter that I created for a sheet in this app's desktop counterpart. I get to re-invent the wheel each time I want to apply a filter with this app. If this is not a user error on my part I would appreciate this being addresed in a future update. Thanks for your attention.

I usually have to close (or wait for it to crash, which is frequent) and reopen it three times to do as much as add a single column. It was easier to write this review than to add a simple subtraction formula. The web version is good, but GOOGLETRANSLATE (which I use frequently) seems to crash it a lot, while everything seems to crash the mobile version.

I'm having issues with this that I don't have on PC using a browser. Every so often this app removes the ability to edit my documents, saying I don't have permission, yet it registers that my Google account both has permission to edit and is the only account with those permissions. What is going on? I've never had these issues until a few months ago and it's just getting worse.

Update: Went to settings -> general -> apps -> app info -> storage, cleared data, and cleared cache (and there was a third item that disappeared). When I reloaded the file it allowed me to save edits like normal. Lost three days of data trying to figure this out. Previous: Was working fine. File would auto save when closing the app. Just updated. Now have to save local file with new filename after editing. So annoying. Should have never updated.

It is embarrassing that and app by Google could have so many bugs, especially randomly changing my document to "View Only" WHILE I'M WORKING IN IT and switch out of the app for a second, which is fixed randomly or if I go change the permission to "View Only" back to "Edit" (closing the app doesnt work). Also these all used to be one app under Drive instead of needing multiple apps. For an enterprise level app, too many frustrations

For some reason the app keeps making files available offline, I have it set so it shouldn't do this. but it's does EVERY SINGLE DAY, but I don't use Google sheets often. I haven't made a new file through or used them in almost a year! So it's not like it is downloading new files every day. So I dont know why it's doing that and it drains my battery so I'm deleting all of my Google drive apps because they all do it. (Sheets, docs, and drive)

I use sheets on a daily basis. On a daily basis the document I'm working on will randomly go into view only mode. The only way to edit the doc again is to clear data and cache for the app. Restarting the app or phone does not fix. A simple Google search shows this as an on going problem for YEARS. Worthless to have an app that gets stuck in read only mode with no way to reconnect within the app

For some reason, all the data you put in a cell will only save if you press the checkmark on the top-right of the textbox, and will automatically revert to its previous state if you exit text editing in any other way. Also, the app is not great at handling large spreadsheets, frequently crashing and forcing you to wait before it will open again.

Google's recommendations of clearing the cache increased the share email problems! Major limitations with the app! The app has much less features than the web version. On my tablet I can't access the web version, as it just goes to the app. The app is also not sending shared documents to chosen recipients and not sending even the email share notification. PCs are not disability accessible for me, so these are major issues.
data.replyText: Hi Sarah. We suggest you clear apps cache on your device: Settings - Apps - Sheets - Storage & cache - Clear cache. We'll share your feedback with our product team. Thanks!

data.text: Allow us to move the function icons. I have limited mobility and since the last update the back & forward buttons (that I use all the time on my tablet) have switched from the top right to the top left and I can no longer reach them comfortably or without pain. If I was able to move them I could put all the functions I use most within easy reach for me. As the positioning is now I can no longer use an app I need to use every day.
data.replyText: Hello Tandri, thanks for sharing your valuable feedback. We'll pass this along to our team. Appreciate it!

data.text: Used to have no issues with this app, and since December (I have done all updates) it is constantly crashing. I keep having to clear the cache every ten minutes, even to access tiny files. If I have a file open and have to move to another app for a minute, I come back and it's crashed and sometimes hasn't saved my changes. Really frustrating!
data.replyText: Hi Grainne. You may post the query in Docs community and get help from our experts: https://goo.gle/3o58rPT. Thank you.

data.text: Update: cleared cache - nothing changed. Since the last update the save button, below document title, closes the document... Very annoying!!!! Lay out of buttons is different, totally unnecessary and makes it less comfortable to work with. It used to work perfectly, now it sucks.
data.replyText: Hi Carlijn. We suggest you clear apps cache on your device: Settings - Apps - Sheets - Storage & cache - Clear cache. We'll share your feedback with our product team. Thanks!

data.text: Unfortunately I have created a drawing image intended to work as a button trigger and I have assigned an appscript on it but it's not functioning on Google sheet mobile app. But there's no problem in web app, so I used to open my browser and access the file. However in browser, the interface is not user friendly while using it in mobile. I hope you can fix the mobile app to run there the appscript assigned in image drawing. Thanks
data.replyText: Hi Vincent. You may post the query in Docs community and get help from our experts: https://goo.gle/3o58rPT. Thank you.

data.text: Another day, another occurrence of having to uninstall and reinstall the app because of a bug where it changes my permissions to my own Google sheets as view only. Perhaps the app can't be left in the background for too long, but it's annoying... Otherwise it's a great app in terms of replicating most of the functionality of what I would do on my laptop within Google Sheets.

Whenever I open a work document on the app it tends to press buttons on its own. Particularly my home and recent apps buttons. I've had instances when trying to copy an address off a work document the app will preemptively press cut instead of copy before my finger touches my screen. This has been an issue on every samsung phone I've had including the S20 Ultra, ZFold 3, ZFold 4, and most recently S23 Ultra
data.replyText: Hi there. We suggest you clear apps cache on your device: Settings - Apps - Sheets - Storage & cache - Clear cache. If that doesn't help, you may post your query in the Docs Community and get help from our experts: https://goo.gle/3o58rPT. Thank you.

data.text: Let's just say all my MS apps have been binned. Love the app on Android. However, what happened to the tick function to confirm you've finished an action. The tick closes the sheet...not good.. I thought that's what the x was for 🤔. I had a gripe about it last time and google reinstated it. Keen to see this fixed again. Potential to bring back up to 5 stars... 😉

Lacks a ton of features that are included in the web version. Just include all web features! re(edit): There is no issue. I just want to have the full functionality of the web version on Mobile, including all web functions. That's all.
data.replyText: Hi there. Thanks for sharing your inputs! Our product team greatly values your feature suggestions. Please submit your feedback within Sheets app: click the 3 bar menu (top left) - Help & feedback - Send feedback. Appreciate it.

data.text: Is it Excel/Google Sheets on mobile? Yes. Does it lack basic features such as custom colors because the ones you get are not that great? Oh, absolutely. I hate navigating Excel as is, but this is more torturous, and usually gpogle's services are easier to navigate.

Unusable in android through google drive since last update on 13th March. Pages slow to load. They open in read only, and can't see an option to change to write. Font has changed so info doesn't fit in boxes. Still works fine through google sheets app though.
data.replyText: Hi Peter. We suggest you clear apps cache on your device: Settings - Apps - Sheets - Storage & cache - Clear cache. If that doesn't help, you may post your query in the Docs Community and get help from our experts: https://goo.gle/3o58rPT. Thank you.

data.text: Overall experience is good but there is one issue. Dropdown fields (With data validation) takes too much time to load. Even if there are only 2 options in dropdown it takes around 2 to 3 minutes to load. This issue is resolved after latest update, so I am providing 5 star.
data.replyText: Hi Sarvesh. We suggest you clear apps cache on your device: Settings - Apps - Sheets - Storage & cache - Clear cache. If that doesn't help, you may post your query in the Docs Community and get help from our experts: https://goo.gle/3o58rPT. Thank you.

data.text: 4Jan24 update: What's new; Bugs and performance issues. When selecting multiple cells and then long press to bring up context menu (cut/copy/paste), there is an automatic Cut+Paste+Save operation before I've even selected anything. Terrible update. No quality control. 16jan update ... still faulty. Seriously! OMG! Is this some kind of DRAG operation? I hate it. Let me turn it off! Not suitable for smartphones. I hate forced updates.
data.replyText: Hi there. We suggest you clear apps cache on your device: Settings - Apps - Sheets - Storage & cache - Clear cache. If that doesn't help, you may post your query in the Docs Community and get help from our experts: https://goo.gle/3o58rPT. Thank you.

data.text: Current version does not work right. I have a large spreadsheet that I use daily. This version of Sheets only opens a small fraction (800 rows of 2400+) of the spreadsheet. Another phone with an older version of Sheets opens the spreadsheet perfectly. Please fix whatever the glitch is!

data.text: It's a good app overall. But anytime I got stuck in 'view-only' mode as the owner, I can't seem to fix it at all - cleared caches on the app and phone - other than uninstalling and reinstalling the app, which is quite annoying. This persisted for a long time now and didn't seem to get fixed.

data.text: For a long time this has been 4 stars, but lately I frequently end up in the dreaded "Read-only" mode on my own sheets on my own device. I clear the app cache, then clear the app data at a system level, and sometimes that works and other times it doesn't. I've also used the help and feedback section to try and flag it for Google. Getting to a point where I'll be looking elsewhere, which sucks.
data.replyText: Hi Edward. You may post the query in Docs community and get help from our experts: https://goo.gle/3o58rPT. Thank you.

data.text: Not thrilled so far. Not the most friendly for mobile but ok on a computer. My biggest issue is that I created a file and shared it with someone. At some point it decided I didn't have edit access to my own file so I had to access on the other person's device, share it with myself, and make me an editor from that person's device even though they're listed as an editor. I was listed as the owner the whole time. There was no way that I could see to report or get help with this issue.
data.replyText: Hi Ben. You may post the query in Docs community and get help from our experts: https://goo.gle/3o58rPT. Thank you.

data.text: too much a hassle to searching finding the location of any xlsx file created by google sheets and getting the file itself especially if I need to save it in another location/drive/USB and upload it to another third party cloud storage. also this app easily get my files corrupted from using this google sheets. so stupid. I wasted so time creating my project xlsx file only to get corrupted in the end without any backup restore.. even though I save every 5-10 minutes. so stupid app
data.replyText: Hi Charlie. Thanks for sharing your valuable feedback. We'll pass this along to our team. Appreciate it!

data.text: It doesn't have pivot table or many features like WPS has, please update features for tablets,so that it make sens of use , please update features make app useful, it has only 1000 cell in Raw which very less compared to others , please add more , otherwise I had to switch to others app
This app has a serious bug : after some time the sheet becomes read only. I cannot edit it any more. The workarounds what I found is to delete all data & cash of the app. This is really annoying me.
